definition: to fit/suitable/proper/just (now)/comfortable/well/to go/to follow or pursue
ability/talent/sb of a certain type/a capable individual/only/only then/just now

sentences.english: Did you see Joan just now?
What had happened was like a dream.
sentences.chinese: 回想適才之事，真似一夢。

sentences.english: That is the actor I just told you about.
sentences.chinese: 那就是我適才向你提起的阿誰演員。

sentences.english: A boy came to see you a moment ago.
sentences.chinese: 適才有一個小孩來找你。

sentences.english: Ku prattled away, even dragging in the bed plank incident.
sentences.chinese: 顧爾謙還嘮嘮叨叨地牽涉適才牀板的事。

sentences.english: I don't like this cell phone- the one you just showed me.
sentences.chinese: 我不快樂喜愛這部手機，就是你適才給我看的那一部。

sentences.english: A. She talked at you just now.
The boy to whom I spoke is my brother.
sentences.chinese: 適才和我語言的那個男孩是我弟弟。

sentences.english: We should just go back to that street we were on.
sentences.chinese: 我們應該回到適才我們呆的那條街。

sentences.english: I told you to drive slowly: Gary.
sentences.chinese: 加里，我適才叫你開慢點吧。

sentences.english: We go down with whthroughout you said just now.
sentences.chinese: 我們應許你適才所說的意見。

definition: to hold a lamp/to light a lamp
lit. the soul flies away and scatters (idiom)/fig. to be frightened stiff/spooked out of one's mind/terror-stricken
cups and dishes in complete disorder (idiom); after a riotous drinking party
full of youthful vigor (idiom)/in the prime of youth
to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)
to present a treasure/to offer a valuable piece of advice/to show off what one treasures
to hate and resent/angry and full of grievances
